title: Manchester United set price for Alexis Sanchez with no chance of Old Trafford return
text:
Alexis Sanchez has been shipped out on loan (Picture: Soccrates/Getty Images)

Manchester United will attempt to cut all ties with Alexis Sanchez next summer, bringing to an end a disastrous spell at Old Trafford.

The Chile international was shipped out to Inter Milan on loan for the 2019/20 season after failing to replicate the form he’d previously shown at Arsenal and Barcelona.

Sanchez is the club’s top earner, picking up a ridiculous £500,000-a-week, but United chiefs see no way back for him despite him having another three years left on his contract.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

United have struggled in attack this season having failed to adequately replace Sanchez and Romelu Lukaku, who also joined Antonio Conte’s Inter Milan but in a permanent deal, but there is no temptation to bring 30-year-old Sanchez back to ease their attacking woes.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Instead, they have set a £25million asking price for him, according to The Sun.

The money raised from any transfer would be used to pay off his huge wage packet.

A United source told The Sun: ‘The plan is to get some money back and use that to pay off most of his contract.

‘There is a hope that he has a good spell at Inter and they or another club want to take him off our hands next summer.

‘We have a fair valuation as he still has a few good years left in him based on his age and his strong reputation.’

Inter don’t have a commitment to sign him on a permanent basis, with the two clubs agreeing to split his wages during his season-long loan at the San Siro.
